headline: 2 Magnificent S&P 500 Dividend Stocks Down 40% to 70% to Buy and Hold Forever
summary: All investors love their dividends, but merely looking at a stock's dividend yield can be misleading.  After all, a stock with a high yield could suggest that the dividend is about to be cut, that the business may be declining, or that there are other risks, such as high debt.  The following beaten-down dividend stocks -- down 40% to 70% from their highs -- are suffering from the ripple effects of the pandemic and the rise in interest rates.
